Articles.Content:
Welcome, guests, international and otherwise!

We\'ve put Field Dynamics up as a cutting edge burgeoning rocket company who plans to build rockets for any of those willing to hire, regardless of political alignment.

We have our own research goals, and our chief rocket remains an orbit only vehicle;

The PR-4ab type.

We hope to have many promising builds. Nonwithstanding that several major rocket companies already corner the market here on Kerbal, we would like remind everyone that they started somewhere too.

Any suggestions or business propostitions are up for grabs, and the advisory board to me to notify you all we will NOT be yet participating in the Global Market

(That\'s already confusing for me.)

Best regards to Venki, Harvester, and others

-Chair of FD 8)
I see an 'x' in for your picture.
Just finished a point about that-having trouble uploading it, don\'t quite know how.

Just finished a point about that-having trouble uploading it, don\'t quite know how.

For now just add it as an attachment.

Otherwise, welcome to the forums!

Hello and welcome to the forums!

I\'d like to point out that we do have a role playing forum on KSP (located here: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?board=24.0) that can wonderfully accommodate your fashion of writing.

Either way, there are plenty of ways to upload a picture. I, for one, use photobucket. I upload from my computer to there and can then easily link the image to any forum via the image tags ([ img ] [ / img ] without spacing if relevant). Of course each forum has its own unique fashion of image tags, so I\'d investigate that first.

If you need any assistance or advice, or a walkthrough with this problem of not being able to upload, your friendly Mods such as myself and others are here to assist!

Your friendly neighborhood bag of bones,

-Drakomis

Hello and welcome to the forums!

I\'d like to point out that we do have a role playing forum on KSP (located here: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?board=24.0) that can wonderfully accommodate your fashion of writing.

Either way, there are plenty of ways to upload a picture. I, for one, use photobucket. I upload from my computer to there and can then easily link the image to any forum via the image tags ([ img ] [ / img ] without spacing if relevant). Of course each forum has its own unique fashion of image tags, so I\'d investigate that first.

If you need any assistance or advice, or a walkthrough with this problem of not being able to upload, your friendly Mods such as myself and others are here to assist!

Your friendly neighborhood bag of bones,

-Drakomis

Also if you are getting an URL from an image hosting website, look for something around the means of 'Direct Link'
Thanks to Drakomis & Tim, and the quick replies. I\'ve been hunting around the server for awhile, and thought i\'d unveil a company type project.

Thanks to Drakomis & Tim, and the quick replies. I\'ve been hunting around the server for awhile, and thought i\'d unveil a company type project.

Very happy to help! Thanks to tim to! Good luck!
